patterns: Can I reactivate my inactive Flipkart account?
responses: Yes, you can reactivate your inactive Flipkart account. Simply log in using your existing credentials, and if your account is inactive, follow the on-screen prompts to reactivate it.

patterns: Do I need to verify my mobile number or email address every time I log in?
responses: Verification is typically a one-time process. After verifying your mobile number or email address during the account creation, you may not need to verify it every time you log in, unless there are security concerns or changes to your account information.

patterns: What is an OTP or verification code?
responses: OTP stands for 'One-Time Password.' It is a temporary code sent to your registered mobile number or email address to verify your identity during certain activities, such as logging in or making changes to your account settings.

patterns: Why do I need to verify my mobile number or email address to log into my Flipkart account?
responses: Verifying your mobile number or email address adds an extra layer of security to your Flipkart account. It helps ensure that only authorized users can access and make changes to the account, protecting your personal information and transactions.

patterns: How can I change the password for my Flipkart account?
responses: To change your Flipkart account password, log in and go to the 'Account Settings' or 'Profile' section. Look for the 'Change Password' option, enter your current password, and then set a new one following the provided instructions.

patterns: How can I use a new email address to log in to my Flipkart account?
responses: To use a new email address to log in, log into your Flipkart account with the existing credentials. Once logged in, navigate to the 'Account Settings' or 'Profile' section and choose the option to update your email address. Follow the prompts to add and verify the new email.
